3027.text: A case study described the occurrence of squamous-cell carcinoma as a complication of a basal-cell epithelioma, which was managed with injections of 5-FU.
3027.response: No. Squamous-cell carcinoma is not listed as an adverse effect of 5-FU in this text. It is described as a complication of a basal-cell epithelioma.

2953.text: A patient arrived with a hand that was swollen, discolored, and in pain after injecting a mixture of diamorphine and methylphenidate into their radial artery.
2953.response:
Yes.
No. The swollen, discolored, and painful hand is likely due to injecting a mixture of diamorphine and methylphenidate into the radial artery, not specifically an adverse effect of methylphenidate alone.
